intro: Benthamina, commonly known as the "buttercup of the desert," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. Benthamina species are typically short-lived annuals or perennials, adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. Their botanical features include hairy stems, alternate leaves, and a preference for well-drained soils.
